texto: 7.1.1.2 Numerical The characteristics of data that are typically of interest are their central value (most often described by the average or “mean”), and the spread or dispersion (usually measured by the range or “standard deviation”). Another characteristic of interest is the distribution of the data, for which there are quantitative measures that describe the shape of the distribution (such as the degree of “skewness”). © ISO 2021 – All rights reserved  ﻿ 9 ISO 10017:2021(E) ﻿
